intro: Oxytheca perfoliata, commonly known as the perforate leaf or false thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves that have perforations, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of South America and is often found in dry, open habitats. Oxytheca perfoliata is known for its adaptability and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
